bibliography:
Sämtliche Werke. Textkritische Ausgabe [Collected Works:
Critical Edition]. Edited by K.  Schuhmann and B. Smith, 2
volumes, Munich: Philosophia Verlag, 1989.

1912/1913, Die Überlegung: ihre ethische und rechtliche
Bedeutung [Deliberation: Its Ethical and Legal Significance],
in Sämtliche Werke, 279–311.
1921, Gesammelte Schriften, Halle: Max Niemeyer.

1911a, “The Supreme Rules of Rational Inference According to
Kant,” James M. DuBois (trans.), Aletheia, VI:
81–97, 1994.

1911b, “Kant's Interpretation of Hume's
Problem,” J.N. Mohanty (trans.), Southwestern Journal of
Philosophy, 7 (1976): 161–88.

1911c, “On the Theory of the Negative Judgement,”
Barry Smith (trans.), in Parts and Moments. Studies in Logic and
Formal Ontology, B. Smith (ed.), Munich: Philosophia Verlag,
1982.

1913, “The A Priori Foundations of Civil Law,” John
Crosby (trans.), Aletheia, 3 (1983): 1–142.

1921a, “Concerning Phenomenology,” D. Willard
(trans.), The Personalist, 50 (1969): 194–211;
originally published as “Vortrag über
Phänomenologie”, in Reinach 1921, 379–405.

Three Texts on Ethics, James Smith and Mette Lebech
(trans.), Munich: Philosophia, 2017. [Translations of essays written
between 1906 and 1913: “Grundbegriffe der Ethik”
(“Basic Concepts of Ethics”), “Die Überlegung:
Ihre ethische und rechtliche Bedeutung” (“Reflection: Its
Ethical and Legal Significance”), and “Grundzüge der
Ethik” (“Basic Features of Ethics”).

Austin, John. 1962. How to Do Things with Words, Oxford:
Oxford University Press.

Baltzer-Jaray, K., 2009. “Adolf Reinach Is Not a
Platonist.” Symposium: Canadian Journal of Continental
Philosophy, 13 (1): 100–12.

Burkhardt, Armin. 1990. Speech Acts, Meaning and
Intentions, Berlin: Walter de Gruyter.

Camilleri, S., 2012. “The German Fathers of the Theological
Turn in Phenomenology: Scheler, Reinach, Heidegger.” in The
Heythrop Joural. doi:10.1111/j.1468-2265.2012.00764.x

Chrudzimiski, A., 2012. “Negative States of Affairs: Reinach
versus Ingarden.” in  Symposium: Canadian Journal of
Continental Philosophy  (Revue Canadienne De Philosophie
Continentale), 16(2), 106–127.

Crosby, John. 1983. “Reinach as a Philosophical Personality,”
Aletheia, III: xi-xxxi.

–––. 1990. “Speech Act Theory and
Phenomenology,” in
Speech Acts, Meaning and Intentions, edited by A. Burkhardt.
Berlin: Walter de Gruyter.

DuBois, James M. 1994. “Introduction to ‘The Supreme
Rules of Rational Inference According to
Kant’,” Aletheia, VI: 81–97.

–––. 1995. Judgment and Sachverhalt: An
Introduction to Adolf Reinach's Phenomenological Realism,

–––. 2002. “Adolf Reinach: Metaethics and the

Husserl, Edmund. 1900–01. Logical Investigations,

–––. 1913. Ideas Pertaining to a Pure

Ingarden, Roman. 1964–65. Der Streit um die Existenz der

Pfänder, Alexander. 1921. “Logik,” Jahrbuch

Scheler, Max. 1913. Formalism in Ethics and Non-Formal

Schuhmann, Karl, and Smith Barry. 1987. “Adolf Reinach: An
